\vspace{0.25in}



# 1.

Compute the derivatives of the following functions.

a. $f(x) = e^{2x}$

b. $g(x) = \displaystyle e^{x^2}$

c. $h(x) = \displaystyle x^2e^{x^2}$

d. $f(x) = \displaystyle e^{e^{2x}}$

e. $f(x) = \displaystyle e^{ 2x(x+3)}$

f. $f(x) = \displaystyle \frac{e^x-1}{x}$

# 2.

Compute the derivatives of the following functions.

a. $f(x) = \ln(2x)$

b. $f(x) = x\ln(x)$

c. $g(x) = x^2\ln(x^2)$

d. $h(x) = \ln(x^2+3x+1)

e. $f(x) = \displaystyle\frac{1}{\ln(x)}$

f. $g(x) = \displaystyle \frac{1+(\ln(x))^2}{x}$

# 3.

Use logrithmic differentiation to find $y'$.

a. $y = 2^x$

b. $y = \displaystyle \frac{(x+2)e^x-2x}{x-1}$

c. $e^y = (x-2)(x^2+1)$

d. $\displaystyle\frac{y-2}{3-y}=\frac{2-x}{x^2+1}$
